Fairly fun game! I did get this a while back for free, don't remember how but I never played it until recently.

Its challenging due to the fact that the names for the chemicals are difficult to remember at some points. I recommend setting custom element names to avoid confusion on higher difficulties.

Does this game entertain? Yes. Is the price worth? No.

In essence, its a very simple game in that you're locked inside a lab, shrinking in size as time goes on. There isn't a story line or anything to progress. Its simple that it brings joy, but only worth if the price was $5 give or take.

Évaluation publiée le 28 mai 2021
This is such a fun little game. It's just one of those games that you try and whether or not you have high expectations going in, you immediately see the appeal of it.

Controls are pretty solid
Gameplay is simple, but definitely a "Easy to learn, hard to master" kinda thing.
The achievements are fairly simple but a good amount of them you definitely have to go out of your way to earn.
The shrinking mechanic changes the gameplay so much, definitely very unique.

My only complaint is that I wish there were a few incentives to play with a ton of formulas, or just much harder labs in general. The "Crazy" challenge is really nothing too bad. Maybe something along the lines of... I dunno, short timers on each machines, but maxed out formulas, spill enabled, 10~12mins limit, rollercoaster shrinking etc. I think it could be kinda fun. Maybe a simple achievement to complete a lab with maxed formulas with no more than 20minutes would work too.

The gameplay is really a ton of fun, so really I just kinda want excuses to play it more tbh.

The game is quite short, but it is of fantastic quality, so I think the price is perfect for it.

Honestly, if you want simple fun for an evening or two, I say look into trying it.

Produit reçu gratuitement

In Size Matters übernehmt ihr die Rolle eines Chemikers, der versehentlich eine chemische Mischung erstellt hat, die ihn kontinuierlich schrumpfen lässt. Euer Ziel ist es in einer vorgegebenen Zeit die richtigen Chemikalien miteinander zu kombinieren um ein Gegenmittel herzustellen. Dabei wird euer Charakter natürlich die ganze Zeit kleiner und ihr seit irgendwann darauf angewiesen Rampen oder Kisten zu stapeln damit ihr eure Arbeitsflächen weiterhin erreichen könnt.

Im Spiel gibt es insgesamt 5 Geräte. Der Chemical Processor, die Mikrowelle, ein Code Kombinierer, den Gegenmittelhersteller sowie ein Gerät zum zerlegen von bereits gemischten Chemikalien. Es gibt außerdem mehrere Maps und später sogar die Möglichkeit alle Einstellungen einer Runde zu verändern und auf diese Weise die Chemikalien sogar eigens zu benennen.

Fazit: Ein echt tolles Gelegenheitsspiel für Zwischendurch.

Évaluation publiée le 6 avril 2021
Pretty fun game! Don't expect 100h of play time but the hours you will play are worth it. The core concept of the game is hilarious and you can expect some funny moments. I think I would compare this game to a solo Overcooked, even if the gameplay is quite different.

A lot of sliders and options can significantly increase the replayability: gravity, size reduction curve, starting height, ending height, etc. There are also several maps which don't change the gameplay a lot, but it is still enough to make them unique and make the games different. Depending on your settings, this game can become a mix of platforming, puzzle, speedrunning, small scale exploration, etc. The increasing tension of using the right recipes and creating a stair out of box in prevision of bringing the last antidote key is both funny and thrilling

Short (ha). Sweet, and surprisingly fun, I initially came to the game with an interest in how the shrinking was tackled, but I stayed for the surprisingly fun (and challenging in some cases!) gameplay! You'll be surprised how much fun this game is if you give it a try! It's inspired by Inch by Inch, sure, but this game has much more production and overall quality that just makes it the more fun! It's got quick, get in and have fun arcade-style gameplay. There is no story to the game, just you are a shrinking science person struggling to stop your shrinking before it's too late, nothing more too it. I'd definitely give it a shot, especially considering so few games tackle shrinking these days.

Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

This is a unique & fun puzzle game. The game is still in beta, so there is still quite some things that are lacking which is to be expected. The graphics are great & the little storey is fun. I like that you are able to tweak just about every aspect in the game to your liking, from breakable beakers to spillable fluids. The few things that I don't like are how far away the items are that you hold. more often than not I'm moving beakers over the shelves instead of in front of me. Once you play one or two games, you've essentially played the whole game. The start of every game is finding every clipboard with the recipes & the ingredients. It doesn't take long to find them & they don't take long to mix together.

Overall it is a fun game to kill some spare time. The lack of gameplay is slightly dissapointing. However, the game is still in beta & the developer will add more content.

1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mars 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Ein gutes kleines Spiel für Zwischendurch.
Man ist ein Wissenschaftler, der im Rennen gegen die Zeit in seinem Labor ein Gegenmittel herstellen muss.
Dabei schrumpft er immer weiter. Gegeben sind diverse Zutaten und Hinweise im Labor, die einem helfen, die Schlüsselzutaten für das Gegenmittel herzustellen. Während man kleiner wird, muss man auch schauen, dass man sich aus Kartons Erhöhungen baut, damit man weiterhin an die Ausrüstung kommt.

Durch die vielen Einstellungsmöglichkeiten, die man vor jedem Spiel einstellen kann, bietet das Spiel Abwechslung, wodurch es immer einen Wiederspielwert hat.
Je weiter man schrumpft, desto schwieriger wird es, an die Ausrüstung zu kommen. Je nachdem, wie schwer man es hier einstellt, kann das Spiel herausfordernd werden, wenn man schnell schrumpft.
Wenn man das Spiel weiter individualisieren will, kann man den Zutaten auch eigene Namen vergeben.
Die Steuerung im Spiel selber ist einfach und unkompliziert, das anvisieren der Zutaten und Geräte zum Interagieren an einigen Stellen lediglich etwas ungenau.
Die Grafik ist simpel, und schlicht, und vollkommen ausreichend.
Die Musik passt sich dem Spiel an, anfangs ist sie ruhig, aber je knapper die Zeit wird, desto anspornender wird sie. Insgesamt passend und atmosphärisch.

Fazit: Für Zwischendurch definitiv ein gutes, witziges Spiel, wenn man Herausforderungen mag und viele individuelle Einstellungen am Spiel machen können möchte.
